page.title: 20BURY BANK
page.content: The land rising from the flood plain of the River Trent, to 400 feet above sea level in the west, and to 500 feet above sea level in the east. This incorporates the key ancient earth works of Bury Bank, but only a west corner, is on the grid reference referred to. Bury Bank is an Iron Age hill fort, and was probably associated with Wulfren, King of Mercia from 659 to 675 A.D. It consists of a badly weathered and eroded bank, and ditch, enclosing an area of three acres with a single entrance on the north _ west side.
